welcome.data: Warm-up prompt: “On a website, where have you seen bullet points or links used effectively?” Students write 2–3 short responses.

aim.data: State the agenda/objective: Learn how to use <ul>, <ol>, <li>, and <a> for lists and links, and how to implement anchor tags for in-page navigation.

review.data: Ask: “How do you structure content semantically in HTML?” Recap usage of semantic elements like <main>, <nav>, etc.

relevant.data: Instructor-led live coding demo in WebStorm: build unordered and ordered lists, hyperlinks, and anchor links using real examples.

interactive.data: Students create their own web page using lists and links. Include external and internal (anchor) links.

ownership.data: Students personalize their page with header/footer, creative content, and publish it to GitHub Pages. Submit assignment link via Canvas.

resonate.data: Exit reflection: “When do you use <ul> vs <ol>?”, “What’s the key to making a link work?”, “How can this improve a real-world site?”

supplies.data: Computers with WebStorm, internet access, GitHub accounts, access to Canvas, and sample starter code for demonstration and practice.
